docs.lead_paragraph: On Monday, Times reporters answered reader questions about how the health care overhaul will affect consumers. But one reader question that remained unanswered was how the legislation will affect Americans abroad. Here's the answer.

headline.main: What the Health Care Overhaul Means for Americans Abroad

docs.abstract: How the new health care legislation will affect Americans living abroad.
docs.snippet: How the new health care legislation will affect Americans living abroad.

docs.lead_paragraph: Most of the major provisions in the health care legislation do not take effect for months, if not years.

headline.main: Obama Has Signed the Bill. Now What?

docs.abstract: The provisions of the health care bill that will go into effect right now.
docs.snippet: The provisions of the health care bill that will go into effect right now.

docs.lead_paragraph: Infertility in men may signal a higher risk for aggressive prostate cancer, a new study suggests.

headline.main: Male Infertility Linked With Prostate Cancer

docs.abstract: New research linking male infertility with aggressive prostate cancer joins a growing body of evidence that male infertility is an important risk factor for long-term health problems.
docs.snippet: New research linking male infertility with aggressive prostate cancer joins a growing body of evidence that male infertility is an important risk factor for long-term health problems.

docs.lead_paragraph: If there was a single event that guaranteed Democrats the 216 votes they needed to adopt major health care legislation, it was the agreement that President Obama would issue an executive order clarifying federal policy banning the use of taxpayer money for abortions.
docs.abstract: The text of the president's executive order on abortion coverage.
docs.snippet: The text of the president's executive order on abortion coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The prospects looked dicey more than a time or two, but President Obama signs into law this morning the health care overhaul that has consumed debate in Washington for months.

headline.main: The Early Word: How a Bill Becomes a Law

docs.abstract: President Obama has invited lawmakers to the White House, where he will preside over a ceremony and sign the health care bill.
docs.snippet: President Obama has invited lawmakers to the White House, where he will preside over a ceremony and sign the health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Legg Mason's Bill Miller, a celebrated value investor, thinks cheap health care stocks should perform well in the next few months now that legislative uncertainty about reform in the sector has been removed, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Legg Mason's Miller Likes Health Care Stocks

docs.abstract: Legg Mason's Bill Miller, a celebrated value investor, thinks cheap U.S. healthcare stocks should perform well in the next few months now that legislative uncertainty about reform in the sector has been removed, Reuters reported.
docs.snippet: Legg Mason's Bill Miller, a celebrated value investor, thinks cheap U.S. healthcare stocks should perform well in the next few months now that legislative uncertainty about reform in the sector has been removed, Reuters reported.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials in a dozen states plan to argue that requiring people to buy health insurance is an unprecedented intrusion by the federal government into people’s lives.

headline.main: Health Measure’s Opponents Plan Legal Challenges
headline.print_headline: Health Measure’s Opponents Plan Legal Challenges

docs.snippet: Officials in a dozen states plan to argue that requiring people to buy health insurance is an unprecedented intrusion by the federal government into people’s lives.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has gained an infusion of political capital, but it may not help him advance his agenda in Congress.

headline.seo: Lessons for the President After Health Care Triumph
headline.main: Lessons for the Democrats, Some Perhaps Cautionary, After a Signal Triumph
headline.print_headline: Lessons for the Democrats, Some Perhaps Cautionary, After a Signal Triumph

docs.snippet: President Obama has gained an infusion of political capital, but it may not help him advance his agenda in Congress.

docs.lead_paragraph: With Medicare off the deficit-reduction table, Social Security stands as the likeliest source of large savings.

headline.main: Next Big Issue? Social Security Pops Up Again
headline.print_headline: Next Big Issue? Social Security Pops Up Again

docs.snippet: With Medicare off the deficit-reduction table, Social Security stands as the likeliest source of large savings.
